22af645d1859cb5ca6da0c484f1f37ea (11:34): why apache's api changed so frequency? you can use 2.0 with svn/dav,but with 2.2 you can not
22af645d1859cb5ca6da0c484f1f37ea (11:35): are you use aubversion to backup your website?
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:36): you just need to recompile subversion for apache 2.2... your repos should still be safe
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:36): you can't reuse modules over major revisions of apache anyway...
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:37): doesn't matter if it's from 1.3 to 2.0 or from 2.0 to 2.2
9e23a0a7ecb4f403e4b67b8aea2aa66e (11:37): ok, will mod-ssl work with apache 2.2?
4bc12623df533363997e0571f98d2c0b (11:37): Hey all, is there an easy way to log POST content for every URL used?
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:37): poofer: mod_ssl is built in to 2.0 and 2.2
4bc12623df533363997e0571f98d2c0b (11:38): Basically, I'm trying to trace down a possible PHP exploit.
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (11:38): if i compile 2.2 with ssl, mod_ssl is built in
22af645d1859cb5ca6da0c484f1f37ea (11:38): i see,but the subversion sources's compile does not mention 2.2
9e23a0a7ecb4f403e4b67b8aea2aa66e (11:38): i am going to go hide in a room till i figure this out
